Title: Mineral Physics: An Introduction and Overview
Abstract: © 2015 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.Mineral physics uses our understanding of the physical and chemical properties of minerals to interpret deep Earth geophysical properties and processes. A brief history of mineral physics is presented, and the importance of the interplay between theory, experiment, and more recently computational simulation is emphasized. The current model of our mineralogical interpretation of the deep Earth is outlined, with reference to subsequent chapters in the volume. The future opportunities that new instrumentation and computational facilities offer are briefly discussed, again with reference to the more detailed chapters in the volume.
